page.title: 03RIVER-CONSERVATION
page.content: { Kent Angling Association}owns a certain amount of river in our area and the{North West Water Authority}own the part of the river running through the town centre. The Kent Angling Association works hard for conservation by asking members to refrain from leaving discarded line and lead shot, and also members should use{"NON-SPILL"}shot containers but rivers in the{NW}are too fast flowing for shot to take effect on swans.The K.A.A. has 250 members and has a five year waiting list.Members pay{Â£6-Â£25}for a season ticket depending on type of licence. To fish on the NWWA waters you need to pay from{Â£2-Â£10}for a permit if you are over 14, but if you are under 14 then you do not have to pay for a permit.
